member.name: T:SFML.Audio.Listener
member.summary: The audio listener is the point in the scene from where all the sounds are heard

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Listener.GlobalVolume
member.summary: The volume is a number between 0 and 100; it is combined with the individual volume of each sound / music. The default value for the volume is 100 (maximum).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Listener.Position
member.summary: 3D position of the listener (default is (0, 0, 0))

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Listener.Direction
member.summary: The direction (also called "at vector") is the vector pointing forward from the listener's perspective. Together with the up vector, it defines the 3D orientation of the listener in the scene. The direction vector doesn't have to be normalized. The default listener's direction is (0, 0, -1).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Listener.UpVector
member.summary: The up vector is the vector that points upward from the listener's perspective. Together with the direction, it defines the 3D orientation of the listener in the scene. The up vector doesn't have to be normalized. The default listener's up vector is (0, 1, 0). It is usually not necessary to change it, especially in 2D scenarios.

member.name: T:SFML.Audio.Music
member.summary: Streamed music played from an audio file

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Music.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a music from an audio file
member.param: Path of the music file to open

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Music.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Constructs a music from a custom stream
member.param: Source stream to read from

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Music.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructs a music from an audio file in memory
member.param: Byte array containing the file contents

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Music.Play
member.summary:
Start or resume playing the audio stream.
This function starts the stream if it was stopped, resumes it if it was paused, and restarts it from beginning if it was it already playing. This function uses its own thread so that it doesn't block the rest of the program while the stream is played.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Music.Pause
member.summary:
Pause the audio stream.
This function pauses the stream if it was playing, otherwise (stream already paused or stopped) it has no effect.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Music.Stop
member.summary:
Stop playing the audio stream.
This function stops the stream if it was playing or paused, and does nothing if it was already stopped. It also resets the playing position (unlike Pause()).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.SampleRate
member.summary:
Sample rate of the music.
The sample rate is the number of audio samples played per second. The higher, the better the quality.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.ChannelCount
member.summary: Number of channels (1 = mono, 2 = stereo)

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.Status
member.summary: Current status of the music (see SoundStatus enum)

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.Duration
member.summary: Total duration of the music

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.Loop
member.summary:
Flag if the music should loop after reaching the end.
If set, the music will restart from beginning after reaching the end and so on, until it is stopped or Loop = false is set. The default looping state for music is false.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.Pitch
member.summary:
Pitch of the music.
The pitch represents the perceived fundamental frequency of a sound; thus you can make a sound more acute or grave by changing its pitch. A side effect of changing the pitch is to modify the playing speed of the sound as well. The default value for the pitch is 1.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.Volume
member.summary:
Volume of the music.
The volume is a value between 0 (mute) and 100 (full volume). The default value for the volume is 100.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.Position
member.summary:
3D position of the music in the audio scene.
Only sounds with one channel (mono sounds) can be spatialized. The default position of a sound is (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.RelativeToListener
member.summary:
Make the music's position relative to the listener or absolute.
Making a sound relative to the listener will ensure that it will always be played the same way regardless the position of the listener. This can be useful for non-spatialized sounds, sounds that are produced by the listener, or sounds attached to it. The default value is false (position is absolute).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.MinDistance
member.summary:
Minimum distance of the music.
The "minimum distance" of a sound is the maximum distance at which it is heard at its maximum volume. Further than the minimum distance, it will start to fade out according to its attenuation factor. A value of 0 ("inside the head of the listener") is an invalid value and is forbidden. The default value of the minimum distance is 1.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.Attenuation
member.summary:
Attenuation factor of the music.
The attenuation is a multiplicative factor which makes the music more or less loud according to its distance from the listener. An attenuation of 0 will produce a non-attenuated sound, i.e. its volume will always be the same whether it is heard from near or from far. On the other hand, an attenuation value such as 100 will make the sound fade out very quickly as it gets further from the listener. The default value of the attenuation is 1.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Music.PlayingOffset
member.summary:
Current playing position of the music.
The playing position can be changed when the music is either paused or playing.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Music.ToString
member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Music.Destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handle the destruction of the object
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: T:SFML.Audio.SoundStatus
member.summary: Enumeration of all possible sound states

member.summary: Sound is not playing

member.name: F:SFML.Audio.SoundStatus.Paused
member.summary: Sound is paused

member.name: F:SFML.Audio.SoundStatus.Playing
member.summary: Sound is playing

member.name: T:SFML.Audio.Sound
member.summary: Regular sound that can be played in the audio environment

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Sound.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor (invalid sound)

member.summary: Construct the sound with a buffer
member.param: Sound buffer containing the audio data to play with the sound

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Sound.#ctor(SFML.Audio.Sound)
member.summary: Construct the sound from another source
member.param: Sound to copy

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Sound.Play
member.summary:
Start or resume playing the sound.
This function starts the stream if it was stopped, resumes it if it was paused, and restarts it from beginning if it was it already playing. This function uses its own thread so that it doesn't block the rest of the program while the sound is played.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Sound.Pause
member.summary:
Pause the sound.
This function pauses the sound if it was playing, otherwise (sound already paused or stopped) it has no effect.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.Sound.Stop
member.summary:
Stop playing the sound.
This function stops the sound if it was playing or paused, and does nothing if it was already stopped. It also resets the playing position (unlike pause()).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Sound.SoundBuffer
member.summary:
Buffer containing the sound data to play through the sound.
It is important to note that the sound buffer is not copied, thus the SoundBuffer instance must remain alive as long as it is attached to the sound.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Sound.Status
member.summary: Current status of the sound (see SoundStatus enum)

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Sound.Loop
member.summary:
Flag if the sound should loop after reaching the end.
If set, the sound will restart from beginning after reaching the end and so on, until it is stopped or Loop = false is set. The default looping state for sounds is false.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Sound.Pitch
member.summary:
Pitch of the sound.
The pitch represents the perceived fundamental frequency of a sound; thus you can make a sound more acute or grave by changing its pitch. A side effect of changing the pitch is to modify the playing speed of the sound as well. The default value for the pitch is 1.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.Sound.Volume
member.summary:
Volume of the sound.
The volume is a value between 0 (mute) and 100 (full volume). The default value for the volume is 100.

member.summary:

Only sounds with one channel (mono sounds) can be spatialized. The default position of a sound is (0, 0, 0).

member.summary:
Make the music's position relative to the listener or absolute.
Making a sound relative to the listener will ensure that it will always be played the same way regardless the position of the listener. This can be useful for non-spatialized sounds, sounds that are produced by the listener, or sounds attached to it. The default value is false (position is absolute).

Minimum distance of the sound.
The "minimum distance" of a sound is the maximum distance at which it is heard at its maximum volume. Further than the minimum distance, it will start to fade out according to its attenuation factor. The attenuation is a multiplicative factor which makes the music more or less loud according to its distance from the listener. An attenuation of 0 will produce a non-attenuated sound, i.e. its volume will always be the same whether it is heard from near or from far. On the other hand, an attenuation value such as 100 will make the sound fade out very quickly as it gets further from the listener. The default value of the attenuation is 1.

member.name: T:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer
member.summary: Storage for audio samples defining a sound

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Construct a sound buffer from a file
Here is a complete list of all the supported audio formats: ogg, wav, flac, aiff, au, raw, paf, svx, nist, voc, ircam, w64, mat4, mat5 pvf, htk, sds, avr, sd2, caf, wve, mpc2k, rf64.
member.param: Path of the sound file to load

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Construct a sound buffer from a custom stream.
Here is a complete list of all the supported audio formats: ogg, wav, flac, aiff, au, raw, paf, svx, nist, voc, ircam, w64, mat4, mat5 pvf, htk, sds, avr, sd2, caf, wve, mpc2k, rf64.
member.param: Source stream to read from

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Construct a sound buffer from a file in memory.
Here is a complete list of all the supported audio formats: ogg, wav, flac, aiff, au, raw, paf, svx, nist, voc, ircam, w64, mat4, mat5 pvf, htk, sds, avr, sd2, caf, wve, mpc2k, rf64.
member.param: Byte array containing the file contents

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.#ctor(System.Int16[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Construct a sound buffer from an array of samples
member.param: Array of samples
Channel count
Sample rate

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.#ctor(SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer)
member.summary: Construct a sound buffer from another sound buffer
member.param: Sound buffer to copy

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.SaveToFile(System.String)
member.summary:
Save the sound buffer to an audio file.
Here is a complete list of all the supported audio formats: ogg, wav, flac, aiff, au, raw, paf, svx, nist, voc, ircam, w64, mat4, mat5 pvf, htk, sds, avr, sd2, caf, wve, mpc2k, rf64.
member.param: Path of the sound file to write
member.returns: True if saving has been successful

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.SampleRate
member.summary:
Sample rate of the sound buffer.
The sample rate is the number of audio samples played per second. The higher, the better the quality.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.ChannelCount
member.summary: Number of channels (1 = mono, 2 = stereo)

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.Duration
member.summary: Total duration of the buffer

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.Samples
member.summary:
Array of audio samples stored in the buffer.
The format of the returned samples is 16 bits signed integer (sf::Int16).

member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBuffer.Destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handle the destruction of the object
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: T:SFML.Audio.SoundBufferRecorder
member.summary: Specialized SoundRecorder which saves the captured audio data into a sound buffer

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundBufferRecorder.SoundBuffer
member.summary:
Sound buffer containing the captured audio data
The sound buffer is valid only after the capture has ended. This function provides a reference to the internal sound buffer, but you should make a copy of it if you want to make any modifications to it.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBufferRecorder.ToString
member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBufferRecorder.OnStart
member.summary: Called when a new capture starts
member.returns: False to abort recording audio data, true to continue

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBufferRecorder.OnProcessSamples(System.Int16[])
member.summary: Process a new chunk of recorded samples
member.param: Array of samples to process
member.returns: False to stop recording audio data, true to continue

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundBufferRecorder.OnStop
member.summary: Called when the current capture stops

member.name: T:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder
member.summary: Base class intended for capturing sound data

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.Start
member.summary:
Start the capture using the default sample rate (44100 Hz).
Please note that only one capture can happen at the same time.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.Start(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Start the capture.
The sampleRate parameter defines the number of audio samples captured per second. The higher, the better the quality (for example, 44100 samples/sec is CD quality). This function uses its own thread so that it doesn't block the rest of the program while the capture runs.
Please note that only one capture can happen at the same time.
member.param: Sound frequency; the more samples, the higher the quality (44100 by default = CD quality)

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.Stop
member.summary: Stop the capture

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.SampleRate
member.summary: Sample rate of the sound recorder.
member.remarks: The sample rate defines the number of audio samples captured per second. The higher, the better the quality (for example, 44100 samples/sec is CD quality).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.ChannelCount
member.summary: Get/Set the channel count of the audio capture device
member.remarks: This method allows you to specify the number of channels used for recording. Currently only 16-bit mono (1) and 16-bit stereo (2) are supported.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.IsAvailable
member.summary: Check if the system supports audio capture.
member.remarks: This function should always be called before using the audio capture features. If it returns false, then any attempt to use the SoundRecorder or one of its derived classes will fail.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.ToString
member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.OnStart
member.summary:
Start capturing audio data.
This virtual function may be overridden by a derived class if something has to be done every time a new capture starts. If not, this function can be ignored; the default implementation does nothing.
member.returns: False to abort recording audio data, true to continue

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.OnProcessSamples(System.Int16[])
member.summary:
Process a new chunk of recorded samples.
This virtual function is called every time a new chunk of recorded data is available. The derived class can then do whatever it wants with it (storing it, playing it, sending it over the network, etc.).
member.param: Array of samples to process
member.returns: False to stop recording audio data, true to continue

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.OnStop
member.summary:
Stop capturing audio data.
This virtual function may be overridden by a derived class if something has to be done every time the capture ends. If not, this function can be ignored; the default implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.SetProcessingInterval(SFML.System.Time)
member.summary:
The processing interval controls the period between calls to the onProcessSamples function. You may want to use a small interval if you want to process the recorded data in real time, for example.
Note: this is only a hint, the actual period may vary. So don't rely on this parameter to implement precise timing.
The default processing interval is 100 ms.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.AvailableDevices
member.summary: Get the list of the names of all available audio capture devices

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.DefaultDevice
member.summary: Get the name of the default audio capture device

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.SetDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Set the audio capture device
member.param: The name of the audio capture device
member.returns: True, if it was able to set the requested device

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.GetDevice
member.summary: Get the name of the current audio capture device
member.returns: The name of the current audio capture device

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.Destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handle the destruction of the object
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundRecorder.ProcessSamples(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Function called directly by the C library ; convert arguments and forward them to the internal virtual function
member.param: Pointer to the array of samples
Number of samples in the array
User data -- unused
member.returns: False to stop recording audio data, true to continue

member.name: T:SFML.Audio.SoundStream
member.summary: Abstract base class for streamed audio sources

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Play
member.summary:
Start or resume playing the audio stream.
This function starts the stream if it was stopped, resumes it if it was paused, and restarts it from beginning if it was it already playing. This function uses its own thread so that it doesn't block the rest of the program while the stream is played.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Pause
member.summary:
Pause the audio stream.
This function pauses the stream if it was playing, otherwise (stream already paused or stopped) it has no effect.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Stop
member.summary:
Stop playing the audio stream.
This function stops the stream if it was playing or paused, and does nothing if it was already stopped. It also resets the playing position (unlike pause()).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.SampleRate
member.summary:
Sample rate of the stream
The sample rate is the number of audio samples played per second. The higher, the better the quality.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.ChannelCount
member.summary: Number of channels (1 = mono, 2 = stereo)

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Status
member.summary: Current status of the sound stream (see SoundStatus enum)

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Loop
member.summary:
Flag if the music should loop after reaching the end.
If set, the music will restart from beginning after reaching the end and so on, until it is stopped or Loop = false is set. The default looping state for music is false.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Pitch
member.summary:
Pitch of the stream.
The pitch represents the perceived fundamental frequency of a sound; thus you can make a sound more acute or grave by changing its pitch. A side effect of changing the pitch is to modify the playing speed of the sound as well. The default value for the pitch is 1.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Volume
member.summary:
Volume of the stream.
The volume is a value between 0 (mute) and 100 (full volume). The default value for the volume is 100.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Position
member.summary:
3D position of the stream in the audio scene.
Only sounds with one channel (mono sounds) can be spatialized. The default position of a sound is (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.RelativeToListener
member.summary:
Make the stream's position relative to the listener or absolute.
Making a sound relative to the listener will ensure that it will always be played the same way regardless the position of the listener. This can be useful for non-spatialized sounds, sounds that are produced by the listener, or sounds attached to it. The default value is false (position is absolute).

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.MinDistance
member.summary:
Minimum distance of the music.
The "minimum distance" of a sound is the maximum distance at which it is heard at its maximum volume. Further than the minimum distance, it will start to fade out according to its attenuation factor. A value of 0 ("inside the head of the listener") is an invalid value and is forbidden. The default value of the minimum distance is 1.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Attenuation
member.summary:
Attenuation factor of the stream.
The attenuation is a multiplicative factor which makes the music more or less loud according to its distance from the listener. An attenuation of 0 will produce a non-attenuated sound, i.e. its volume will always be the same whether it is heard from near or from far. On the other hand, an attenuation value such as 100 will make the sound fade out very quickly as it gets further from the listener. The default value of the attenuation is 1.

member.name: P:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.PlayingOffset
member.summary:
Current playing position of the stream.
The playing position can be changed when the music is either paused or playing.

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.ToString
member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Initialize(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set the audio stream parameters, you must call it before Play()
member.param: Number of channels
Sample rate, in samples per second

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.OnGetData(System.Int16[]@)
member.summary: Virtual function called each time new audio data is needed to feed the stream
member.param: Array of samples to fill for the stream
member.returns: True to continue playback, false to stop

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.OnSeek(SFML.System.Time)
member.summary: Virtual function called to seek into the stream
member.param: New position

member.summary: Handle the destruction of the object

member.name: T:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Chunk
member.summary: Structure mapping the C library arguments passed to the data callback

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.GetData(SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Chunk@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called each time new audio data is needed to feed the stream
member.param: Data chunk to fill with new audio samples
User data -- unused
member.returns: True to continue playback, false to stop

member.name: M:SFML.Audio.SoundStream.Seek(SFML.System.Time,System.IntPtr)

User data -- unused
